title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 12 February 2012 - XWiki
content:
01:11 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
01:25 <@sdumitriu> You're up late, vmassol  
01:26 <vmassol> yep just back from a party at some friends's place...  
01:26 <vmassol> will go to bed real soon :)  
01:30 <vmassol> night time! nn  
01:30 <vmassol> has quit  
02:48 <tekzilla> has quit  
02:49 <DrLou> has quit  
02:52 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <rrodriguez> Good morning! Please, anybody out there with a couple of minutes to help me to move a simple scrip to syntax XWiki 2.0? Thanks in advance!  
11:18 <dbaeli> has joined #xwiki  
11:29 <vmassol> rrodriguez: shoot your question!  
11:29 <vmassol> btw did you try the automatic conversion?  
11:32 <vmassol> rrodriguez: I've replied on the list  
11:37 <rrodriguez> vmassol: thanks! I've tried the automatic conversion, but it failed.  
11:38 <rrodriguez> vmassol: please, let me know if I can be of any further help by testing some trick. I'll check the list. Thanks again!  
11:45 <dbaeli> has quit  
11:47 <rrodriguez> vmassol: thread followed in the list. Thanks for your help!  
11:50 <vmassol> rrodriguez: you're missing new lines between html macros  
11:50 <vmassol> you can have a single html macro  
11:50 <vmassol> no need to have several  
11:50 <vmassol> try writing directly in wiki syntax  
11:50 <vmassol> to understand how to use the hmtl macro  
11:50 <vmassol> then you can convert in groovy  
11:51 <rrodriguez> I'm afraid I'm missing something... too much time without enjoying XWiki...  
11:51 <rrodriguez> several macros?  
11:51 <rrodriguez> I've sent two trials, but I'm only using one at the time...  
11:52 <rrodriguez> let me double read your messages...  
11:55 <vmassol> has quit  
12:00 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:17 <alem0lars> has joined #xwiki

15:21 <dbaeli> has joined #xwiki  
15:23 <dbaeli> has quit  
15:32 <jvdrean> has quit  
15:46 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
16:07 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* r86582d0 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/86582d047d0cfdf11d0acc09a8b03b3a3b622754 / pom.xml : XCOMMONS-100: Upgrade Maven Archetype plugin to version 2.2 - http://git.io/P5IAcQ  
16:54 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* r499d5cf https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/499d5cfa1d32fcc742cd0b5be24dcfa46293cddc / pom.xml : XCOMMONS-101: Upgrade Maven Findbugs plugin to version 2.4.0 - http://git.io/ibn9SQ  
17:24 <jvdrean> has quit  
17:41 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I think we should be able to display all document "metadata" in the AllDocs livetable. For example we should be able to see the "parent" values, the last modified dates, etc. I wonder what kind of UI we could devise to make this fit and look nice visually…  Maybe add the ability to pass specific column names in the URL query string and have some advanced button to display a list of column that can be displayed, with checkbox  
17:43 <vmassol> my need right now is the parent field. I'd like to create a "children" wiki macro which lists all children of the current document and if there are too many, to link to the all docs livetable to list all documents having a given doc as the parent  
17:48 <alem0lars> has quit  
18:44 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* r072cdcd https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/072cdcddd02d13b0de8a6b829bad12ad31283b7b / xwiki-commons-tools/xwiki-commons-tool-xar-plugin/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/tool/xar/XarMojo.java : [Misc] Removed unused code - http://git.io/x4D\_cA  
19:09 <kwoot> has joined #xwiki  
19:09 <kwoot> has quit  
19:09 <kwoot> has joined #xwiki  
19:10 <kwoot> Hello. This is a test.  
19:11 <kwoot> has quit  
19:47 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: What was the conclusion of the 4.0 RM?  
20:13 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I'm sending the proposal mail on the list tomorrow  
20:13 <vmassol> I forgot to send it on last Friday  
20:13 <vmassol> (I have it almost ready)  
20:36 <dbaeli> has joined #xwiki  
20:44 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: XWIKI-7523  
20:56 <dbaeli> has quit  
22:16 <vmassol> sdumitriu: yep, thanks
